column4: wyzard: oh ok.. so how can i free up space in "/" ? i try to remove old packages? from synaptic package remover?
wyzard: but I've already removed as much as i can!
pelo: just delete stuff from there?
I did do autoclean, but I need to cleanup 450 mb, and not just a few mbs
do you have the development tools installed?  Remove them and add them afer upgrading.  KDE too if you have it installed.
marcn: oh yeah, i could remove kde i guess... what's the command for that, if you know that?
Try: dpkg --list |grep kde   and then apt-get remove kde or kde-base or whatever
marcN: thanks a lot man, I think that's gonna work for me
marcn: i still can't upgrade, says I need to free an additional 440 m fo disk space on '/'... how do I free space in '/'?
remove more packages.  Do you have lots of stuff in /var/cache/?
marcn: no.. i don't have anything!!!
I have ~2k packages in ~5.6G on /   My /home is elsewhere
marcn: as far as i know, my home is elsewhere in /home as well..
how much disk is used on your / ?  I have ~2000 packaegs which consume ~5.6G of space. I could remove the dev tools to make it smaller.
